**Course Description:**

        Teaching Reading and Writing in ESL/EFL Contexts provides an introduction to issues and strategies of reading and writing instruction in a wide variety of contexts. The class will be conducted in a seminar format and students are expected to lead as well as actively participate in Quality Talk discussions. The reading materials will include empirical studies as well as book chapters. Students will have opportunities to conduct a final project to further explore an issue of their interest.

**Grading Policy:**

*   Participation                     20%

**Final Project:**

Option 1: A Research Project Proposal

A research project proposal should include a statement of the research problem, a review of literature, research questions, research method, timelines, and expected outcomes and their importance.

Option 2: A Course Proposal

A course proposal that presents a comprehensive plan for an integrated reading and writing course in a specific context (elementary, secondary, tertiary, selective/alternative course, summer/winter camp), including the rationale, a description of the student population, the syllabus, and other teaching materials.
